video.title: Code a Minecraft Clone with JavaScript, React, Three.js – Tutorial
video.description:
Learn how to code a playable Minecraft clone using React, JavaScript, and Three.js. You will learn about many React concepts such as useState, useEffect, useRef, custom Hooks for State management, and more. And you will be able to apply the principles to create other 3d games in JavaScirpt.

✏️ Course created by Daniel Bark. Check out his channel: https://www.youtube.com/c/barelycoding

💻 Finished Code: https://github.com/danba340/minecraft-freecodecamp
💻 Starting Code: https://github.com/danba340/minecraft-freecodecamp/tree/start
💻 Demo: https://minecraft-freecodecamp.vercel.app

⭐️ Contents ⭐️
⌨️ (0:00:00) Boilerplate
⌨️ (0:03:56) Sky
⌨️ (0:05:46) Textures
⌨️ (0:07:48) Ground
⌨️ (0:15:11) Player
⌨️ (0:25:43) Keyboard input
⌨️ (0:32:03) Movement
⌨️ (0:41:26) First person camera
⌨️ (0:46:25) State management
⌨️ (0:49:55) Cube component
⌨️ (0:58:02) Add/Remove Cubes
⌨️ (1:09:34) Texture Selector
⌨️ (1:21:34) Save world
⌨️ (1:27:31) Hover cubes
⌨️ (1:30:28) Outro

--

🎉 Thanks to our Champion and Sponsor supporters:
👾 Raymond Odero
👾 Agustín Kussrow
👾 aldo ferretti
👾 Otis Morgan
👾 DeezMaster

--

Learn to code for free and get a developer job: https://www.freecodecamp.org

Read hundreds of articles on programming: https://freecodecamp.org/news

topLevelComment.author: Barely Coding with Daniel Bark
topLevelComment.text:
Hope everyone enjoys and learns from this video <3 
Good to know: When clicking to lock the cursor to the mouse, click as close as you can to the cursor. That aligns the camera center and mouse. Any offset between clicked position and center of viewport is not handled in this tutorial.

replies.text: Ey thanks a bunch for your old Minecraft & R3F vids m8. Got introduced to R3F, Cannon.js & Zustand at the same time thanks to you. Much appreciated.

replies.author: Killer Pop Holly
replies.text:
This tutorial is amazing. I'm a React dev, but no knowledge with Three, and my son loves this game. So everyone wins :D I'm starting some stuff with Three, and my son comes see when I made a new feature 😁

So the tuto's just perfect, but I am on Typescript, old habit 😅, so I have to think more sometimes, but I love that. For ex I'm on the onClick method on the Cube, so I typed the event : ThreeEvent<MouseEvent>, but when I have to put AltKey, it does not works, because of the MouseEvent, there is no AltKey on a Mouse 🤣🤣. But I got it

I just have a little camera glitch, sometimes it cut off a nano second and turns on another pov. But I will see that later.

topLevelComment.author: Henry Z
topLevelComment.text:
I have the same exact code, but when I try to save, it does indeed save as it will have the same state upon reload, but it immediately crashes and blank page with the console returning the error:

Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read properties of undefined (reading 'texture')
in TextureSelector.js:16 
(among others, "cannot read properties" addCube, cubes, saveWorld)

Everything else works, including the reset button, and I even mapped keys to the buttons so wouldn't have to exit the pointerlock (which was also causing an uncaught error)

Any ideas to why this is happening?

not sure if it is right. but it works.

topLevelComment.author: Super Jellyfish
topLevelComment.text: All that has been taught here is how to throw Javascript frameworks at everything, and how to make explicitly just some "Minecraft clone".  There are no real valuable concepts to any kind of programming and software development outside of the JavaScript frameworks in this video.

replies.author: Nathan Hedglin
replies.text:
EVERY LANGUAGE HAS FRAMEWORKS.

They are tools. You're welcome to build the same with vanilla JS. It'll be much more difficult, especially the 3D stuff.

replies.author: Barely Coding with Daniel Bark
replies.text: Strongly disagree! There are many valuable concepts you could learn in this video. Both from React, from three.js but also just JS concepts. Frameworks lets us jump in on the abstraction level that we desire. Some like to use 3D libraries like R3F and some want to build things more from scratch.
